intro: Rottboellia digitata var. simplex, commonly known as slender false brome, is a perennial grass native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features slender,丛生 stems that grow close to the ground, often forming dense mats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves with a slightly rough texture. Its small, spike-like inflorescence produces numerous tiny flowers, which are wind-pollinated. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some areas.
